p: Compound 3 is present in the essential oil of Kaempferia galanga which has a long history of fragrance use to improve sleep [ 26, 35]. Recent pharmacological studies found inhalation of whole galangal oil and oral administration of its extract had a sedative effect in mice [ 22, 26]. In the same study [ 22], it was inferred the sedative activity of galangal oil arises from the collective effect of the different components. Therefore, the decrease in spontaneous motor activity of mice caused by compound 3 suggests a possible contribution of the compound in the overall activity of galangal oil and indicative of its own sedative activity.
